utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Push me and I’ll let her die, just so you’ll stop annoying me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Here’s my theory: you’re jealous. He’s maturing, he’s accepting responsibility, you’re emotionally stuck at seventeen.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s manufacturing responsibility, he’s not maturing. He hasn’t changed at all.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So then, why do you care?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That black ooze we saw? That was a bowel movement. Out of her mouth.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You’re trying to end this conversation by grossing me out? I’m an oncologist. Half of my patients have their skin sloughing off. Why are you so worried about this guy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He was having a rough time with his girlfriend. He was in love, he was always in love. He wanted to marry her, but I thought she was flaky, sending mixed signals.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So, you gave him advice and she dumped him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I told him that I would talk to her.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And you blew it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Technically… I was doing him a favor, she was nuts!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Stop the biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’m right at her liver.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s House. He says stop.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Check it out.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Please tell me you didn’t have us stop the biopsy to check out some tunes!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: His left hand is very subtle, very delicate.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: This girl is dying.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Be dying a lot faster if I let you do that obviously unnecessary biopsy. Now listen.

utterance.speaker: Jesse Baker
utterance.content: I asked for this tuned! Did you get this instrument tuned?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: My God! Grandpa was an angry drunk, if only we’d known!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Here’s how to become a great artist. First, get miserable. Misery drives you to become a great artist, but the art does nothing for your misery, which drives you to drugs, which makes you a lousy artist, and this is not lousy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You’re saying he didn’t do drugs?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not when he played this. Something was screwing with his personality.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, drugs and alcohol don’t do that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And that note that he says is out of tune, it’s not, which means that something is screwing with his aural perception, too. Now, what happens when you add all that to the liver disease, which he supposedly died of?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Too much iron. He could have had hemochromatosis, that’s genetic.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Unless you can tell me Miles Davis couldn’t play stoned –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Played better when he wasn’t. I think, I mean, no one knows for sure.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’ll get Leona a TIBC and serum ferritin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We can test this in three minutes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, what is she, Foreman? Light-skinned black chick or dark-skinned white chick?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not sure. Can we hear the music again?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It’s too early to see jaundice from the liver.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: True. This is a photograph of Leona when she was 13 years old. She’s darker now.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She’s been living on the streets for eight months.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No tan line, so unless those streets she’s been living on are indoor streets, I’m thinking she’s got iron deposits in her melanin, both byproducts of hemochromatosis, just like Granddad used to make. SQUID exam to calculate the amount of iron in her blood. And treat her with deferoxamine, she’ll be fine by lunch. ‘Cause, you see, I was wrong before, about the breakfast….

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There’s the iron, and lots of it.

utterance.speaker: Patrick
utterance.content: I’m not going to get this job, am I?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s a done deal. I knew it the moment I saw you. Interview’s just a formality.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House, what are you –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lisa Cuddy, this is Patrick Glidahan. Patrick’s going to be the new intern rotating in my department.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I didn’t even know you were looking for one, nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Patrick
utterance.content: Sorry. I laugh when I’m nervous.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bet you’ve been doing that your whole life, huh?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What kind of medicine are you interested in, Patrick?

utterance.speaker: Patrick
utterance.content: Cancer, infectious disease, the big devils. I think that medicine has become too institutionalized. We need to send a message to our patients that we’re just like them. I mean, we’re all people.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We’re all people. I like that. She’s all hard science, facts. I like to know a person’s hopes and dreams. What kind of music do you like, Patrick?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Actually, I don’t –

utterance.speaker: Patrick
utterance.content: I’m a Mozart man. He says what I feel, but can’t express.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I’m late for a meeting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You see, this is why the face-to-face interview is so important. You’ve got to know who you’re getting in bed with.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Get him out of here.

utterance.speaker: Crandall
utterance.content: What’s happening?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Crash cart! She’s not getting any air.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: CT shows her lungs are Swiss cheese. Ventilator’s helping, but at this point, her time is basically up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We developed a theory: hemochromatosis. Like good scientists we tested that theory, we proved that theory. We acted based on that proof and we treated her. As a result of which, she is on the verge of death. Is it just me, or have we discovered a flaw in the scientific method? Walk me through it, step-by-step. What is supposed to happen when you give someone deferoxamine?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It’s a chelating agent.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What does the chelating do?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Removes excess iron from the liver.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Iron is heavy, it gets stuck. Deferoxamine is like a lubricant. It makes the iron slick so it can move around again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Moves around where?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It’s supposed to be discharged through waste.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Her waste system is a little screwy right now, means the waste can’t go where it wants to go. What if it went to the lungs?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Whatever’s in the lungs likes iron, bound with it, started poking holes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What likes iron?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oxygen attaches itself to iron, which increases the chance of infection.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And when we started massive antibiotics prior to the radiation…

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Some neurodegenerative diseases like iron.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Her MRI was clean, no iron deposits on the brain.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Fungus likes iron.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No objections to that one?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If a fungus is doing all this, she’s dead. There are 25 anti-fungals, if we don’t know which –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When in doubt, go broad.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Most common is Aspergillus.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Continue to ventilate her lungs, get her on a voriconazole drip, hope she has Aspergillus.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The process is confidential. You violated his privacy! How did you even –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I looked up ‘loser’ in the cryo bank. You wouldn’t look within a hundred miles of that idiot, and yet you’re willing to have his baby.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I’m not looking for a date, I’m tired of looking for a – ow!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cotton ball? I don’t care if you marry this guy, date this guy, go through his garbage, but you should know. Genes matter. Who you are matters. Find somebody you trust.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Someone like you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Someone you like.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Listen, oh, sorry!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s not what you think.

utterance.speaker: Ingrid
utterance.content: I rub his leg.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, Ingrid! Hi. Okay, you feel guilty about stealing the guy’s girl, I get that, and I’m glad. It’s a good thing. But you did the paternity test. And either the paternity test comes back negative and you shove it in the guy’s face, or it comes back positive and you shut up and your leg starts hurting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or I never ran the test. Not what you think!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Leona’s lung’s collapsed. The treatment’s not working, we’ve got the wrong fungus.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can stop. She ruined it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Three rules for hunting fungus. Location, location, location.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Crandall says she was living in the children’s shelter in Ridgeland.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, the one thing we know for sure is she was not living in the children’s shelter in Ridgeland.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why would he lie about that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He wouldn’t, if he believed her story about the sweet little girl trying to do the right thing.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We can’t ask Leona where she was, she’s intubated.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don’t try to talk, you’ve got a big medical thing in your mouth. Just blink if you understand. Fantastic. Blink if you lied to Crandall about everything. You picked up a fungus somewhere. If you were living in the shelter like you told your new daddy I got nothing to go on, and you will die. So, did you lie to Crandall? You’re a lousy con artist. First rule of the game is know your mark. Once you got Crandall to bite on the poppet thing you had him. You could have told him that you were servicing Al Qaeda’s suicide bombers for crack, this guy would still let you pick out the colors in your new room. Did you lie to Crandall? Where were you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And the winner is… oh, you read it, I just get so nervous at these things.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Recording studio.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She read the book. She knew how much Crandall hated that place, what went on there. She overplayed her hand.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She was desperate. If she didn’t sell this, she was stuck in Hell.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Recording studio doesn’t help us, medically.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Recording studios. Why are these buildings different from all other buildings?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Soundproofing. Absorbs sound, also absorbs moisture.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where there’s moisture, a lot of it, let’s say, Katrina moist, there’s –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Zygomycosis. Only occurs at the highest levels of mold.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Start her on an IV drip of Amphotericin B with colony stimulating factors. She’ll be fine by… dinner.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She’s going to be fine.

utterance.speaker: Crandall
utterance.content: She said she’d never go back there.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She lied to you. She’s your kid – get used to it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Thank you for the injections.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re welcome. You came all the way up here just to tell me that?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pretty much normal. Liver function tests are good.

utterance.speaker: Crandall
utterance.content: Thanks, G-man.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What makes you think you’d be a good father?

utterance.speaker: Crandall
utterance.content: I don’t know. Feels right. It feels good.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, at least you’ve got a good reason.

utterance.speaker: Crandall
utterance.content: It feels good is a good enough reason. What’s happening?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She’s choking, she can’t breathe. Get him out of here, will you? Out! Quick, the curtain! You’re breathing on your own, choking’s normal. I lied to him, I ran a paternity test. Your lie was a bad one. He is your dad. We’re even.
